name: Mitchell Marsh
analysis: Beast bat. If he doesn't bowl, he's expensive.

name: Pat Cummins
analysis: Smartest captain. Cutters work beautifully on slow decks.

name: Travis Head
analysis: Attacks in Powerplay before ball grips. Takes pitch out of equation.

name: Glenn Maxwell
analysis: The Big Show. Off-spin is a weapon here. Match winner.

name: Adam Zampa
analysis: Conquered India in IPL. Skiddy leggie who traps LBW.

name: Josh Hazlewood
analysis: Pitch it on a coin. Boring, consistent, effective.

name: Nathan Ellis
analysis: Skiddy, great back-of-hand slower ball. Ideal for Asia.

name: Josh Inglis
analysis: Sweeps and reverse sweeps well. Smart buy.

name: Marcus Stoinis
analysis: The Hulk. Hits spin big, bowls heavy balls that stick.

name: Tim David
analysis: Pure power. Good for flat decks, risky on turners.

name: Cooper Connolly
analysis: Young talent. Left-arm spin is useful.

name: Matthew Short
analysis: BBL superstar, hasn't cracked international code.

name: Tawhid Hridoy
analysis: Best young bat. Rotates strike well.

name: Taskin Ahmed
analysis: Heart and pace. Best BD pacer.

name: Nasum Ahmed
analysis: Dart master. Tight but low wickets.

name: Harry Brook
analysis: Modern genius. Shots all around. Pillar.

name: Jos Buttler
analysis: IPL legend. Knows these pitches well.

name: Phil Salt
analysis: Brutal. Wins it in 6 overs if flat.

name: Jofra Archer
analysis: Elite skill, fragile body. High risk.

name: Adil Rashid
analysis: Slower through air. England's biggest weapon here.

name: Sam Curran
analysis: Uses cutters well. Good for sticky wickets.

name: Liam Dawson
analysis: Highly skilled spinner. Restricts runs well.

name: Rehan Ahmed
analysis: Young leggie. Good option for turning tracks.

name: Suryakumar Yadav
analysis: The best player of spin in the world. Sweeps, scoops, destroys. Mandatory.

name: Abhishek Sharma
analysis: Explosive spin-hitter. His left-arm spin is a massive bonus in Asia.

name: Tilak Varma
analysis: Technically gifted. Plays spin late. Perfect anchor for turning tracks.

name: Sanju Samson
analysis: When he clicks, he is effortless. Good against spin, but inconsistent.

name: Shivam Dube
analysis: The "Spin Destroyer". Stand and deliver. A tactical nuke in middle overs.

name: Ishan Kishan
analysis: Likes the ball coming on. Might struggle on slow turners, but explosive.

name: Hardik Pandya
analysis: Seam bowling all-rounder who balances the side. Clutch player.

name: Arshdeep Singh
analysis: Left-arm angle + death over yorkers. Very effective on slow wickets.

name: Jasprit Bumrah
analysis: The Cheat Code. Cutters, yorkers, bouncers‚Äîhe has it all.

name: Harshit Rana
analysis: Aggressive pacer. Good slower balls. One for the future.

name: Varun Chakaravarthy
analysis: Mystery spin is gold in Asia. If it grips, he is unplayable.

name: Kuldeep Yadav
analysis: Wrist spin is king here. Guaranteed wicket-taker in middle overs.

name: Axar Patel
analysis: Accurate finger spin. Impossible to hit on turners. Bats well too.

name: Washington Sundar
analysis: Powerplay specialist. Uses his height well. High value budget pick.

name: Rinku Singh
analysis: Learned his trade on slow KKR pitches. The ultimate finisher.

name: Paul Stirling
analysis: Huge experience. Hits spin hard. Fitness issue.

name: Mark Adair
analysis: Wicket-taker. Can use the long handle.

name: Curtis Campher
analysis: Fighter. Can contribute with bat and ball.

name: George Dockrell
analysis: Spinner turned finisher. Knows how to scrap.

name: Josh Little
analysis: IPL experience. Hits the deck hard.

name: Harry Tector
analysis: Technically sound against spin. Good anchor.

name: Gerhard Erasmus
analysis: Spins the ball, anchors the chase. Namibia's best player.

name: Zane Green
analysis: Strike rate is too low for this level.

name: Bernard Scholtz
analysis: Left-arm orthodox. Very stingy on turning tracks.

name: Ruben Trumpelmann
analysis: Left-arm swing is valuable everywhere. Wicket-taker.

name: JJ Smit
analysis: Hard hitter. If he bowls, his value goes up.

name: Jan Frylinck
analysis: Clever slower balls. Good for slow pitches.

name: Louren Steenkamp
analysis: Not up to international standard yet.

name: Malan Kruger
analysis: Domestic batter. Struggles vs high pace.

name: Nicol Loftie-Eaton
analysis: Hit that record ton. Inconsistent, but has X-factor.

name: Scott Edwards
analysis: Captain who sweeps everything. Very effective method on slow tracks.

name: Colin Ackermann
analysis: Solid pro. Bowls useful off-spin. Stabilizes the middle order.

name: Noah Croes
analysis: Just a backup keeper. Not enough impact for a fantasy squad.

name: Bas de Leede
analysis: Reverses the ball (heavy pace) and bats Top 4. Excellent value.

name: Aryan Dutt
analysis: Tall off-spinner who bowls in powerplay. Very annoying for batters.

name: Fred Klaassen
analysis: Decent left-arm pacer, but lacks the X-factor for these conditions.

name: Kyle Klein
analysis: Too young, too raw. Needs development.

name: Michael Levitt
analysis: Clean hitter. Good wildcard option if you need an opener.

name: Max O'Dowd
analysis: Anchor. A bit slow for modern T20, but won't collapse.

name: Logan van Beek
analysis: High energy. Effective death bowler and hitter.

name: Roelof van der Merwe
analysis: The Bulldog! Experience on turning tracks is huge.

name: Saqib Zulfiqar
analysis: Leg-spinner. Might get a game on a dustbowl.

name: Babar Azam
analysis: King of stability. On tough, slow pitches, you need his class.

name: Mohammad Rizwan
analysis: Sweeps beautifully. Loves low bounce. Guaranteed fantasy points.

name: Shaheen Afridi
analysis: New ball swing is his weapon. Early wickets break the game.

name: Naseem Shah
analysis: Reverse swing specialist! Deadly at the death in these conditions.

name: Haris Rauf
analysis: Pace is high, but can travel on flat decks. Needs to use cutters.

name: Shadab Khan
analysis: Form is poor, but he is a leggie who bats. Worth a punt at low price.

name: Fakhar Zaman
analysis: Spin hitter. If he survives the first 10 balls, he wins the match.

name: Saim Ayub
analysis: Stylish, gives a few overs of spin. Needs to convert starts.

name: Usman Khan
analysis: Knows UAE conditions well. Aggressive intent.

name: Imad Wasim
analysis: New ball darts. Impossible to get away on turning tracks.

name: Abrar Ahmed
analysis: Mystery spinner. Very valuable asset in the subcontinent.

name: Abbas Afridi
analysis: Good variations and back-of-the-hand slower balls.

name: Azam Khan
analysis: Spin basher. Keep him away from high pace and he might work.

name: Iftikhar Ahmed
analysis: "Chacha" bowls handy off-spin. Good for matchups against lefties.

name: Mohammad Amir
analysis: Vintage skills. His cutters are elite on slow decks.

name: Marco Jansen
analysis: Height gives bounce on dead tracks.

name: Dasun Shanaka
analysis: Captaincy experience. Slower balls useful. Poor form.

name: Pathum Nissanka
analysis: Silent warrior. Scores runs while others collapse.

name: Kusal Mendis
analysis: Very good on his day, but prone to rash shots.

name: Charith Asalanka
analysis: Solid middle order. Plays spin well.

name: Wanindu Hasaranga
analysis: 4 overs of gold in Asia. Pinch hitter. Unplayable.

name: Maheesh Theekshana
analysis: Mystery spin in Powerplay. Nightmare to face.

name: Matheesha Pathirana
analysis: Baby Malinga. Slingy action hard to pick under lights.

name: Dunith Wellalage
analysis: Young left-arm spin. Batting needs power.

name: Kusal Perera
analysis: Explosive lefty. Great against spin, injury prone.

name: Dhananjaya de Silva
analysis: Test player trying to play T20. Too slow.

name: Kamindu Mendis
analysis: Ambidextrous spin! Made for these conditions.

name: Niroshan Dickwella
analysis: Plays one scoop shot and gets out.

name: Monank Patel
analysis: Solid anchor. Plays spin decently. Safe pair of hands.

name: Aaron Jones
analysis: Power hitter. Can change a game in 3 overs.

name: Saurabh Netravalkar
analysis: The Oracle! Knows Indian conditions (ex-Mumbai). Smart swing.

name: Andries Gous
analysis: Classy batter. Plays spin well. High value.

name: Harmeet Singh
analysis: Left-arm spin + slogs. Knows Indian domestic cricket well.

name: Shayan Jahangir
analysis: Gets stuck at the crease too often.

name: Milind Kumar
analysis: Ranji veteran. Knows these conditions perfectly.

name: Nosthush Kenjige
analysis: Left-arm spin. Very effective on turning tracks.

name: Ali Khan
analysis: Yorker specialist. Needs to be accurate on slow pitches.

name: Andre Russell
analysis: Brute force works even on slow pitches.

name: Alzarri Joseph
analysis: Fast and angry. Hits the deck.

name: Sherfane Rutherford
analysis: Played a lot in Asia/PSL. Finishes well.

name: Johnson Charles
analysis: Hits hard. Good on flat tracks.

name: Romario Shepherd
analysis: Big hitter. Bowling expensive in Asia.

name: Shimron Hetmyer
analysis: Great player of spin, but fitness issues.

name: Obed McCoy
analysis: Slower ball specialist. Good for Asia.

name: Sikandar Raza
analysis: Subcontinent specialist at heart. Mystery spin + power.

name: Blessing Muzarabani
analysis: Hard to score off. Excellent budget pacer.

name: Richard Ngarava
analysis: Tall lefty. Gets bounce even on dead tracks.

name: Clive Madande
analysis: Decent finisher, struggles vs high pace.
